intro: Melilotoides pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir melilot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and arid environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of nectar for pollinators. Melilotoides pamirica plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
